predicate.note: Frames file for 'enlarge' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 45.4, Framenet entry Expansion.

roleset.name: make bigger

example.name: just transitive
example.text: It appears that the only thing Congress is learning from the HUD story is how *trace* to enlarge its control of the honey pot going to special interests.
example.arg: its control of the honey pot going to special interests

example.name: with EXT
example.text: Avondale Industries Inc., New Orleans, received a $23 million contract from the Navy *trace* to enlarge by 50% the capacity of an auxiliary oiler.
example.arg: the capacity of an auxiliary oiler

roleset.note: Preposition 'by' takes precedence over EXT tag.

example.name: passive
example.text: Elements of the left are also reflexively opposed; they see service as a cover for the draft, or fear the regimentation of youth, or want to see rights enlarged *trace*, not obligations.

example.name: with start and end points
example.text: John enlarged the photo of Mary from wallet-sized to billboard-sized.
